body:
### Problem

Noice is disabled and I'm not using ufo. No crash on 0.9.5. Mentioned on Matrix and was asked to upload crash report.

### Steps to reproduce

I haven't been able to identify a specific way to trigger the segfault.

```

### Expected behavior

no segfault

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2973+gf694d020c Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1713484068

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not tested

### Operating system/version

macOS 14.3.1

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.13.2

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body: We still need a minimal config we can test with `nvim -- clean -u test.lua`.

> Also, can you bisect?

Sorry, I was using --HEAD with homebrew. Just cloned this repo today to build with debug info.
I don't see how that prevents you from using `git bisect`

Found a way to repro:
```
vim.keymap.set("n", "<D-k>", "<C-u>")
vim.keymap.set("n", "<D-j>", "<C-d>")
```
In my config when I hold cmd+j/k and the cursor reaches the beginning/end of the buffer, segfault. With `minimal.lua` (only added the lines above) I was able to trigger it once.

edit: sorry, this is a SIGABRT

ASAN:
```
**/src/nvim/getchar.c:1130:11: runtime error: index 67 out of bounds for type 'uint8_t[67]' (aka 'unsigned char[67]')

title: Segfault every few minutes with D- modifier
